heading: HB02175
0: AN ACT PROVIDING FOR THE DISPOSITION OF THE COCONUT LEVY ASSETS BY THE PRIVATIZATION AND MANAGEMENT OFFICE, CREATING THE COCONUT INDUSTRY FUND COMMITTEE, AND PROVIDING FOR THE MANAGEMENT, INVESTMENT, AND USE OF PROCEEDS OF SUCH ASSETS FOR AND IN BEHALF OF THE COCONUT FARMERS AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
short-title: Coconut Levy Assets Disposition Act Of 2016
mother-bill statusstatus: Vetoed by the President on2019-02-14 Substituted by HB05745
history:
House Bill/Resolution NO. HB02175
FULL TITLE : AN ACT PROVIDING FOR THE DISPOSITION OF THE COCONUT LEVY ASSETS BY THE PRIVATIZATION AND MANAGEMENT OFFICE, CREATING THE COCONUT INDUSTRY FUND COMMITTEE, AND PROVIDING FOR THE MANAGEMENT, INVESTMENT, AND USE OF PROCEEDS OF SUCH ASSETS FOR AND IN BEHALF OF THE COCONUT FARMERS AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES
SHORT TITLE : Coconut Levy Assets Disposition Act Of 2016
ABSTRACT : Mandates the Privatization and Management Office (PMO) to privatize all assets acquired through the use of the Coco Levy Fund.
PRINCIPAL AUTHOR/S : SANTOS-RECTO, VILMA
DATE FILED : 2016-08-01
SIGNIFICANCE: NATIONAL
NATURE : Economic
CO-AUTHORS (Journal Entries) :
1. Bolilia (014 2016-08-23)2. Bravo (M.) (026 2016-09-26)
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE
COMMITEE HEARINGS/ACTIONS:
      1. Scheduled for meeting/hearing on 2016-10-18
          -A Technical Working Group was created to further study the proposed measure together with other Coco Levy Fund bills. The Committee agreed to use HB 6135, the Coconut Farmers and Industry Development Act, as approved in the 16th Congress, as reference bill.
      2. Under study by the Technical Working Group(TWG) on 2016-11-10
          -The Technical Working Group meeting was attended by all sectors which includes small coconut farmers organizations, concerned government agencies and other industry stakeholders. A second TWG meeting was scheduled to continue the deliberation on the proposed
      3. Scheduled for meeting/hearing on 2017-05-23
      4. Approved by the Committee on Appropriations on 2017-05-23
          -Substitute Bill to House Bill Nos. 62, 102, 164, 301, 557, 2175, 2266, 2749, 2833, 2840, 3523, 4089, 4224, 4286, 4632 and 4803 was approved with amendments.
MOTHER BILL: HB05745
ACTIONS TAKEN BY THE COMMITTEE ON RULES
REFERRAL TO THE COMMITTEE ON AGRICULTURE AND FOOD ON 2016-08-08
